title: Ticket #435: DAGMan core dumps if node has POST script and all submit attempts fail
description:
If you have a node for which all of the job submit attempts fail, and that node has a POST script, DAGMan core dumps when trying to write the POST_SCRIPT_TERMINATED event to the log file. The core dump happens when it's trying to figure out whether the log file is XML-format or not. (I'll bet this bug was introduced by the changes to handle log rotation in the user log reading code. I think that in in the past, we defaulted to non-XML in this case, but the log reading code itself is segfaulting.)

(Hmm -- see also Gnats PRs 658 and 799.)

remarks:
It looks like this has actually gotten fixed in 7.2.4 or so. I'm working on adding a test for it to make sure the bug doesn't creep back in. (wenger 2009-07-06)

2009-07-08: okay, just fixed this in 7.2 branch, merged changes to master, pushed everything. It turns out that it wasn't fixed before; there was a problem with the test (which is now also fixed). The problem was caused by changes in the user log reading code to deal with log rotation.
